label: 両
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 53rd  . Nara National Museum . 2001
説明文: A unit of weight used in ancient Japan. Until the medieval period, one ryō was equivalent to approximately forty-one or forty-two grams. In the Edo period, one ryō was equivalent to thirteen grams. One ryō is equal to four bu. Sixteen ryō is one kin. [ 分、斤]
